pullRequest.title: [FLINK-18355][tests] Simplify tests of SlotPoolImpl
pullRequest.bodyText:
What is the purpose of the change
Tests of SlotPoolImpl, including SlotPoolImplTest and SlotPoolInteractionsTest, are somehow unnecessarily complicated in the code involvement. E.g. SchedulerImp built on top of SlotPoolImpl is used to allocate slots from SlotPoolImpl, which can be simplified by directly invoke slot allocation on SlotPoolImpl.
Besides that, there are quite some duplications between tests classes of SlotPoolImpl, this further includes SlotPoolPendingRequestFailureTest, SlotPoolRequestCompletionTest and SlotPoolBatchSlotRequestTest.
Brief change log

Use SlotPoolBuilder and SlotPoolUtils to refactor test cases related to SlotPoolImpl
Remove the usages of SchedulerImp for slotpool testing
Other possible simplifications

Verifying this change
This change is a trivial rework / code cleanup without any test coverage.
Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): (yes / no)
The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with @Public(Evolving): (yes / no)
The serializers: (yes / no / don't know)
The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): (yes / no / don't know)
Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Kubernetes/Yarn/Mesos, ZooKeeper: (yes / no / don't know)
The S3 file system connector: (yes / no / don't know)

Documentation

Does this pull request introduce a new feature? (yes / no)
If yes, how is the feature documented? (not applicable / docs / JavaDocs / not documented)

nodes.bodyText: can be final
can be final
name it as physicalSlot/allocatedSlot would be better

Looks to me there is not need to have the process to allocate slot1, offer slot and release it.
The slot offering only would be enough to add a free slot.
I think we can simplify it, maybe in a separate commit.
these lines, except for "assertEquals(1, slotPool.getAvailableSlots().size());",  should be in the section of "// we'll also accept non requested slots".
This line is not needed because the allocation id of an AllocatedSlot is immutable.
Better to verify the availableSlots as well.
does releaseFuture.get(); not work?
According to Flink code style, the right bracket should be placed in the line of the last parameter.

Why not replace it with createAndSetUpSlotPool ?
Also for the test case testCheckIdleSlot.

this change is unrelated and not necessary.
Let's exclude it from this commit.
why making this change?

Let's move createSlotPoolImpl() to be below this method because it is first (and only) used here.
Also let's remove the @Nonnull tag of it because it is against current code style.

beforeCommit.message: [fix-up][tests] Fixes in "Try to remove the SchedulerImpl in SlotPoolImplTest"

nodes.bodyText: I'd prefer to move this method to be below createAndSetUpSlotPool() because it is first and only invoked there.
Boolean -> boolean
why changing the default value of batchSlotTimeout?
A same TIMEOUT is already defined in the test base

It's better have one more indentation for the params to differentiate them from the method body.
Another option is to add an empty line between the params and the method body.
can be static and package private
can be static and package private
a same mainThreadExecutor is already defined in the test base
why removing registerTaskManager()?
why changing registerAndOfferSlots to offerSlots? IIRC, a location must be registered before offering slots from it?
This change should not be part of this commit.
can we have a createAndSetUpSlotPool(JobID)?
Let's name it as jobId which is more common in Flink code.
why removing the default value?
can we invoke connectToResourceManager only when connectToResourceManager==true and resourceManagerGateway != null?

Can we add setters for jobID and connectToResourceManager, and not make them params of build()?
Usually build() params are necessary ones without default values.
Can we have a createAndSetupSlotPool(clock, idleSlotTimeout)?
Okay, when I rearrange the commits I'll take care of this.
I've already added the default value back in the fix-up commit.

Because in most slot pool related test cases the batchSlotTimeout is set to be this value, and only in some test cases, the batchSlotTimeout is set to be 2 milliseconds. I set the default value to be this value, and explicitly set other timeout values in their own cases.
The param connectToResourceManager has been removed in the fix-up commit.
Done.
Removed.
Removed.
I'll put it into the first commit when I rearrange the commits.
Done.
Done. I'll pay attention to this in the future.
Done.
I've already brought it back in the fix-up commit.
Done.
Done.
Done.
I've undone this modification.
looks to me all the createAndSetUpSlotPool(..) methods can be package private?
It's better to invoke super.setup(); first in case it overrides any actions in the sub-class.
nit: allocationId
nit: allocatedSlotFuture
this right bracket should be at the end of the previous line.
registerTaskManager is not need because the following registerAndOfferSlot will do it.
I see. Thanks for the explanation.
I guess this change is unintentional?

Could we have a separate commit to merge SlotPoolInteractionsTest#TestingSlotPool with TestingSlotPoolImpl?
It can be easier to reasoning which methods are ported instead of being newly added.
Could we add this test in a separate commit and elaborate in the commit message for the purpose of it?
the method slotPoolBuilder.build(connectToResourceManager) no longer exists
can we use SlotPoolBuilder to do this by setting resourceManagerGateway to null?
can be final. also applies some other variables below.
I'd prefer to do it right before offerSlot
could we have a createAndSetupScheduler() to deduplicate code?

looks to me requestId is not further used.
This allocation code is used in both test cases. Could we have an allocateSlot() method?
There is no need to verify this offer. IIRC, it is already covered in SlotPoolImplTest.
timeout -> TIMEOUT
indentation or an empty line is needed
indentation or an empty line is needed.
Agreed. Done.
Done.
Got it. Done.

@Nonnull is not needed since it is the default assumption.
Only @Nullable params need to be explicitly tagged.

I think direct main thread executor cannot work here?
Would you give it a check?
Yes. I fix this up in a new commit.
Yes. Undone this change in a new commit.
I forget this. I have removed it.
Done.
Done.
Done.
Agreed and done.
Agreed. I'll do it when arranging the commit.
Done.
Done. I also add final to other variables.
Good idea. Done.
Agreed. Done.
Okay, removed assertTrue.
Thanks for your consideration. I'm still working on this.
I get it. I'll do it when I rearrange the commits.

nodes.bodyText:
We very much want to avoid introducing inheritance into test classes; there is rarely a need for it.
This instance here could be trivially implemented as a junit resource.

looks to me this method is never used.
This method is used only in SlotPoolImplTest. I'd prefer to put it there at the moment.
This method is used only in SlotPoolImplTest. I'd prefer to put it there at the moment.
I'd prefer to have a createAndSetUpSlotPoolWithoutResourceManager() to replace createAndSetUpSlotPool(false).
